title: Fierce Raged the Tempest O'er the Deep

author.name: Godfrey Thring
author.bio: Godfrey Thring was an English hymn writer and Anglican clergyman. He is best known for his hymns which have been included in various hymnals and are still sung today.

lyrics:
Fierce raged the tempest o'er the deep,
Watch did thine anxious servant keep,
But thou wast wrapped in guileless sleep, Calm and still.

Save, Lord; we perish, was their cry.
Oh, save us in our agony,
Thy word above the storm rose high
Peace, be still.

The wild winds hushed, the angry deep Sank like a little child to sleep,
The sullen billows ceased to leap, At Thy will.

So, when our life is clouded o'er,
And storm-winds drift us from the shore,
Say, lest we sink to rise no more:
Peace, be still.
